descript.abstract: Police stations, police outpost and coast guard facilities throughout the state of Grenada. Attribute table is incomplete. The Royal Grenada Police Force did not provide all data requested. In the case where informatin was not provided (i.e. No Data), the value of record in the attribute is displayed as "-9999".
descript.purpose: Developed to locate and visualize police stations in Grenada. This information will help inform the Nature Conservancy's AWE project and the resilience in public safety for Grenada in the face of raising waters. Scientists around the world agree that climate change is indisputable. Impacts, including rising sea levels, increased storm intensity, warming temperatures and acidifying waters, dying coral reefs, shifting fish stocks, and incidence of flooding and drought, are already being felt, and are expected to continue and increase for decades to come. Nature holds some of the world’s best and most practical solutions to climate change, solutions that keep nature and people healthy, safe, and secure. The goal of At the Water’s Edge (AWE) is to demonstrate that governments and people in vulnerable coastal communities in Grenada and St. Vincent and the Grenadines (SVG) can enhance their resilience to climate change by protecting, restoring and effectively managing their marine and coastal ecosystems (also known as ecosystem-based adaptation or EBA) and strengthening local capacity for adaptation.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Country Code 2 - 4 digit country identifier, same as calling code
Parish Code - Unique 2 digit parish identifier
Unique ED identifier consisting of 4 digit country code, and 6 digit Key
Name of island where feature is located
Designates a type to each feature. Specifies whether the feature is a regular police station, training facility or Coast Guard headquarters for example.
The size of the service area.
The number of vehicles at each facility.
The services provided by each feature (i.e. prison, administration, training, etc).
The telephone number of the police station.
